intro: Elytraria marginata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved elytraria, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in humid and moist environments. Elytraria marginata is often used in traditional medicine and has ecological importance in its native habitats.
